report_title: Online Computer & Tablet Sales in the US
executive_summary: The Online Computer and Tablet Sales industry in the United States has experienced substantial revenue growth over the past five years as demand for tablet computers and laptop-tablet hybrid computers has boomed. Additionally, a surging percentage of services conducted online and rising per capita disposable income levels have led to increasing e-commerce spending.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The coronavirus had widespread consequences for global economies, impairing supply chains and accelerating the prevalence of individuals working from home. Despite the overall negative effects on the economy, it also created an opportunity for industry operators to generate revenue. E-commerce sales surged in 2020 as individuals worked from home and children transitioned to remote learning.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Shifting Consumer Preferences Have Affected the Product Mix
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Traditionally, desktop computers have dominated the industry, but laptops and tablets have both grown substantially in terms of revenue. As laptops have become more technologically capable, they are increasingly able to approximate almost every function of a desktop computer with external storage devices. As a result, more portable alternatives have become popular with businesses and consumers alike.

High competition has placed downward pressure on product prices. As more operators have entered the industry to take advantage of the growing demand for portable computing devices, price competition has become more prevalent. Operators have lowered prices to differentiate themselves from competitors and increase their own revenue. Consequently, profit has declined slightly during the period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Growing Online Economy Has Supported Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The easier and more affordable it is to connect to the internet, the more accessible online retailers are, driving consumers to purchase from industry operators.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Positive Economic Conditions Will Contribute to Growing Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the economy continues to grow over the next five years, improving disposable income levels and a greater sense of financial stability for consumers will likely drive demand for industry products.
Industry operators will continue to expand their product selections and have the latest technologies in stock to meet consumer demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Popularity of E-Commerce Will Continue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In addition to improvements in external drivers of demand for industry products, the industry will benefit from the consistent transition of consumers to online shopping.

industry_definition: Operators in the Online Computer and Tablet Sales industry retail desktop, notebook and tablet computers via the internet.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

threats: Price of computers and peripheral equipment

key_trends: Rather than spending in department stores or other retail outlets, consumers are expected to increasingly prefer online alternatives.
As a result, industry revenue is expected to continue to exhibit solid growth.
Online retailers will likely continue to benefit from low operational costs.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes consumers aged 18 to 34.
This market segment includes consumers aged 35 to 54.
This market segment includes consumers aged 55 and older.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment includes desktop computers.
This product segment includes laptops, ultrabooks and hybrids.

tier_1_suppliers: Semiconductor & Circuit Manufacturing in the US
Data Processing & Hosting Services in the US
Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US
Employment & Recruiting Agencies in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Ease of Use Keeps Demand for Tablets High
demand_determinants.determinant_description: User-friendly, interactive operating systems and touch interfaces have enabled tablets to appeal to a wide range of individuals.
An increasing number of consumers prefer ultrabooks because they offer a better compromise.

business_locations.location_description: The West leads the Online Computer and Tablet Sales industry with California having the most industry establishments.
The Southeast is the second-largest region in the Online Computer and Tablet Sales industry.
The Mid-Atlantic is the third-largest region by industry establishment.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
regulations_points.regulation_description: This agreement aims to simplify taxation systems.
The Fair Labor Standards Act sets standards for workers.

basis_points.basis_title: Well-established large companies heighten internal competition
basis_points.basis_description: Well-established large companies in the industry have heightened internal competition.
Operators compete with brick-and-mortar retailers that sell computers and tablets.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Larger players in the industry benefit from brand recognition.

concentration_points.concentration_title: New entrants deterred by established companies
concentration_points.concentration_description: The substantial influence of well-established companies presents obstacles.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the largest expense for operators
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases costs are expected to account for 65.3% of industry revenue in 2023.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Online Computer and Tablet Sales industry has experienced moderate revenue volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Desktop Computers Have Declined in Popularity
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This product segment includes desktop computers.
This product segment includes laptops, ultrabooks and hybrids.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies sell cutting edge computers and tablets; however, they also retail other electronics and devices.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Companies depend on customers' purchases of products to turn a profit.
